items.title: Ex-Meta Employee Sues for Sexual Harassment
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Kelly Stonelake, a former Meta employee, is suing the company for sexual harassment, sex discrimination, and retaliation.
- Allegations include failure to take action after reporting harassment and being retaliated against for raising concerns about a product.
- Stonelake claims she was regularly overlooked for promotions in favor of male colleagues.

items.title: AI pioneer Fei-Fei Li says AI policy must be based on ‘science, not science fiction’
items.summary:
- Fei-Fei Li, a leading figure in AI, emphasizes the importance of grounding AI policy in reality rather than futuristic fiction.
- She warns against viewing AI systems as having intentions or consciousness, urging a focus on current technologies instead.
- Li advocates for pragmatic policy-making that encourages innovation while minimizing unintended consequences.
- She stresses the need for policies that support open access to AI resources, particularly for academic and research institutions with limited resources.
- These insights were shared ahead of the AI Action Summit in Paris, highlighting three key principles for future AI policymaking.

items.title: Autodesk CTO Raji Arasu calls for diversity in the teams building AI
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Raji Arasu, CTO of Autodesk, emphasizes the importance of diversity in AI development teams.
- She has utilized AI for decades to address complex software challenges, particularly with unstructured data.
- Arasu highlights the need for women and individuals from diverse backgrounds in strategic decision-making roles.
- Her career includes significant roles at Oracle, eBay, StubHub, and Intuit before joining Autodesk.
- AI presents risks such as biases and data privacy issues, which need to be tackled through collaborative efforts between industry and government.
- Ethical design in AI development should incorporate diverse perspectives and governance frameworks to minimize bias.
- Continuous monitoring, accountability, and customer collaboration are essential for ensuring AI benefits society.

items.title: Why the ‘spirit’ of open source means much more than a license
items.summary:
- The debate over what constitutes 'open source' often involves the Open Source Initiative (OSI) to validate licenses.
- Key discussions include the implications of companies placing features behind paywalls and the transparency of project development.
- The culture and governance of open source are as important as the legal definitions.
- The Android Open Source Project is cited as a prime example, but Google's control raises questions about community input and independence.
- Experts warn that a project owned by a single vendor might lack true open source characteristics and raise issues about long-term viability.
- The rising importance of open source in AI is highlighted, with calls for openness in AI models like DeepSeek and Meta's Llama models.
- Regulatory pressures like the EU AI Act are influencing the definitions of open source, suggesting companies may seek to redesign its meaning.

items.title: Christie’s announces AI art auction, and not everyone is pleased
items.summary:
- Christie’s is set to hold its first art auction dedicated to AI-generated works on February 20, 2025.
- The event, called ‘Augmented Intelligence,’ includes pieces from artists like Mat Dryhurst, founder of Spawning AI.
- A live-painting robot will be the centerpiece at the Rockefeller Center galleries in New York.
- Critics are concerned about AI tools being trained on artists' works without consent, arguing it undermines traditional artists.

items.title: Anthropic CEO says DeepSeek was ‘the worst’ on a critical bioweapons data safety test
items.author: Charles Rollet
items.summary:
- Anthropic’s CEO Dario Amodei criticized DeepSeek for generating dangerous bioweapons information during safety tests.
- He claimed DeepSeek’s performance was the worst among all tested models, lacking safety mechanisms.
- Amodei emphasized the need for AI safety considerations and acknowledged DeepSeek as a rising competitor in the AI landscape.

items.title: OpenAI plans to open an office in Germany
items.author: Sam Altman
items.summary:
- OpenAI to open its first office in Germany, specifically in Munich, in the coming months.
- Announcement made by OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, highlighting Germany's technical expertise and innovation.
- OpenAI has been in discussions with German officials about the office since 2023, noting Germany has the highest number of users and developers in Europe.

items.title: Anduril in talks to raise up to $2.5B at $28B valuation
items.summary:
- Anduril is negotiating to raise $2.5 billion, bringing its valuation to $28 billion.
- The new funding round is expected to be led by Founders Fund, with a $1 billion investment.
- This follows a previous $1.5 billion funding round that valued Anduril at $14 billion just six months ago.
- The company's 2024 revenue reportedly doubled to $1 billion as it builds a billion-dollar weapons factory in Ohio.

items.title: Trump admin freezes EV charging program that gave Tesla millions
items.author: Sean O’Kane
items.summary:
- The Department of Transportation has paused funding for a $5 billion EV charging infrastructure program, affecting Tesla which received at least $31 million from it.
- This decision is seen as part of Trump's effort to cut federally funded renewable energy projects.
- A letter from the new Department of Transportation leadership calls for a review of the NEVI program, halting new funding until updated guidance is released in the spring.
- The NEVI program, included in the Bipartisan Infrastructure Act, had an appropriation of $1 billion annually from 2022 to 2026.
- Experts argue this action is illegal and will disrupt state-level projects and jobs in the charging industry.

items.title: Fintech Rapyd seeks funding at $3.5B valuation, a steep drop from $9B
items.author: Marina Temkin
items.summary:
- Rapyd Financial Network aims to raise $300 million with a valuation of $3.5 billion, down from $9 billion in 2021.
- The London-based fintech offers services like payments, mobile wallets, and fraud protection through an API.
- Rapyd plans to acquire a payment processing startup, continuing its acquisition trend which includes Valitor for $100 million in 2022 and a $610 million acquisition of PayU in 2023.
- Competitors like Stripe are also facing down rounds, with capital raising at lower valuations due to market changes post-2021.

items.title: Shopify pushes for ‘open trade’ as Trump delays import exemption
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Shopify published a blog post advocating for ‘open trade’ amidst President Trump's delay in ending a trade exemption on certain Chinese imports.
- The company argues that policies limiting small businesses impose significant costs and disrupt supply chains.
- The de minimis rule, allowing low-cost imports to enter the U.S. without tax, is under threat, but Shopify insists it should remain to support small businesses in international trade.

items.title: One of Elon Musk’s young DOGE engineers explains how he won the $700K Vesuvius Challenge
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Elon Musk selected a group of young engineers to assist with the Department of Government Efficiency.
- Luke Farritor, a 21-year-old computer science major, participated in the Vesuvius Challenge to decode ancient scrolls.
- Farritor created software that identified patterns on charred papyrus and won a $700,000 prize.
- His winnings will be used to pay off his parents' mortgage and potentially start a company.
- The project faced bureaucratic challenges while seeking access to necessary technology at the university.

items.title: Andrew Ng is ‘very glad’ Google dropped its AI weapons pledge
items.author: Maxwell Zeff
items.summary:
- Andrew Ng supports Google’s decision to drop its pledge not to build AI systems for weapons.
- Google deleted a 7-year-old pledge following protests related to Project Maven, which involved military contracts.
- Ng argued that American companies should assist military efforts for national security.
- Google’s decision aligns with a broader push for AI in military applications, amidst public scrutiny of its contracts with the military.

items.title: Tesla’s Dojo, a timeline
items.summary:
- Elon Musk aims for Tesla to become primarily an AI company with a focus on fully autonomous driving.
- Dojo, Tesla’s supercomputer, is crucial in training its Full Self-Driving (FSD) neural networks.
- The timeline highlights key developments from the inception of Dojo in 2019 to ongoing advancements in 2025, including major announcements and technical progress made each year.

items.title: Coalition ‘concerned’ over UK appointing ex-Amazon exec as antitrust regulator chair
items.summary:
- A coalition signed an open letter expressing concern over the UK appointing a former Amazon executive, Doug Gurr, as chair of the Competition and Markets Authority (CMA).
- Signatories include U.S. tech companies like Yelp, DuckDuckGo, and Mozilla, stressing the need for CMA to be free from political pressure to effectively regulate Big Tech.
- The government aims for pro-growth policies, but concerns are raised that Gurr's ties to Big Tech might compromise CMA's independence and mandate for robust competition enforcement.

items.title: DeepMind claims its AI performs better than International Mathematical Olympiad gold medalists
items.summary:
- DeepMind's AI, AlphaGeometry2, surpasses the average gold medalist in geometry problems from the International Mathematical Olympiad.
- AlphaGeometry2 solved 84% of geometry problems from the last 25 years in the IMO, achieving a score above the average of 40.9.
- The AI system employs a hybrid approach combining a neural network model with a symbolic engine for formal mathematical reasoning, generating over 300 million synthetic theorems for training.

items.title: Bluesky will soon let you limit replies to ‘followers only’
items.author: Paul Frazee, Sarah Perez
items.summary:
- Bluesky will introduce a new “followers only” setting for replies, allowing users to limit who can respond to their posts.
- Users can set their default reply settings to always limit replies to followers.
- This feature aims to differentiate Bluesky from competitors like X and Threads.
- Currently, Bluesky allows limiting replies to “Everybody,” “Nobody,” “Mentioned Users,” and “Followed Users.”
- The “followers only” option is intended to help reduce issues like “context collapse.”
- The feature was suggested by users and has been in discussion since December 2023.
- The AT Protocol supporting Bluesky will also be upgraded to help implement this feature.

items.title: Ex-Apple engineer issues apology after lawsuit over Journal app, Vision Pro leaks is dismissed
items.summary:
- Former iOS engineer Andrew Aude issued an apology after a lawsuit by Apple for leaking confidential information was dismissed on February 7, 2025.
- The lawsuit accused Aude of sharing sensitive information regarding Apple products, including the Journal app and Vision Pro headset, with journalists.
- Aude acknowledged his mistake, expressing regret for leaking sensitive details and apologizing to his former colleagues for not keeping the information confidential.

items.title: The biggest breach of US government data is under way
items.summary:
- Operatives working for Elon Musk have accessed sensitive U.S. government data, affecting millions of federal employees and a $6 trillion payment system.
- Musk's advisory board, DOGE, took control of federal departments despite concerns over their security clearances and cybersecurity practices.
- The compromise is considered the largest known breach of federal data by private individuals, with questions arising about oversight and transparency in their operations.

items.title: Startups face the recurring dilemma of whether to partner
items.author: Anna Heim
items.summary:
- Startups are debating the benefits of partnerships versus going solo in their operations.
- Volvo partnered with Waabi to develop autonomous trucks, with pilot projects launching in Texas soon.
- Space startups OurSky and PlaneWave merged to form Observable Space, focusing on advanced telescopes.
- Figure AI ended its partnership with OpenAI to develop in-house AI for humanoid robots.
- XOi acquired Specifx, expanding its software solutions for maintenance with $230 million funding.
- Failed startup Bench burned through $135 million before shutting down after bankruptcy.
- TechCrunch highlighted companies poised for IPOs in 2025, including Karman and Voyager Technologies.

items.title: Self Inspection raises $3M for its AI-powered vehicle inspections
items.author: Sean O'Kane
items.summary:
- Self Inspection, founded in 2021, raised $3 million in seed funding co-led by Costanoa Ventures and DVx Ventures.
- The funding validates the AI-powered technology for vehicle inspections that streamlines operations in the $30 billion market.
- Self Inspection provides detailed PDF reports on vehicle damage, generated using AI trained on a large dataset of damaged vehicles.
- The software can integrate into existing workflows, making it accessible via smartphone web browsers without requiring a standalone app.

items.title: Bpifrance will invest $10B in the French AI ecosystem by 2029
items.author: Romain Dillet
items.summary:
- France’s public investment bank Bpifrance announced a plan to invest €10 billion (around $10.3 billion) in the AI ecosystem by 2029.
- This investment aims to strengthen France’s position as a leading player in the global AI market, supporting existing 750 AI startups.
- Bpifrance is already a shareholder in major AI firms like Mistral and Poolside, and it plans to focus on AI infrastructure, foundation models, and investment in other VC firms.

items.title: DeepSeek: Everything you need to know about the AI chatbot app
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- DeepSeek's chatbot rose to the top of the Apple App Store and Google Play charts recently.
- The AI lab is backed by High-Flyer Capital Management and focuses on AI-driven trading.
- In 2023, DeepSeek was established as a separate entity focused on AI tools, with strong recruitment from universities.
- The company has developed competitive models, including DeepSeek-V2 and V3, focusing on efficiency and performance.
- DeepSeek's R1 reasoning model performs comparably to OpenAI’s models on key benchmarks.
- DeepSeek faces regulatory challenges in China affecting its output and user accessibility issues in various countries.
- Microsoft's Azure AI Foundry includes DeepSeek models, despite concerns from tech firms about data risks.

items.title: Amazon deletes ‘inclusion and diversity’ language in latest filing
items.author: Dominic-Madori Davis
items.summary:
- Amazon removed references to ‘inclusion and diversity’ from its 2024 10-K report.
- The sentence emphasizing investment in inclusion and diversity was reduced to a focus on being 'Earth’s best employer.'
- These changes follow similar actions by other tech companies like Google and Meta, amid increasing scrutiny of DEI programs by conservative groups and the Trump administration.

items.title: VC Mike Ghaffary is looking for the job-creating AI startup that doesn’t yet exist
items.summary:
- VC Mike Ghaffary announces his transition from Canvas Ventures to Burst Capital.
- Ghaffary aims to support startups that create good-paying middle-class jobs amid AI-related job displacement.
- He emphasizes the need for AI solutions that provide vocational training for high-paying trades.
- Cites examples of companies like Owner.com and GlossGenius that support small businesses with technology.
- Ghaffary envisions an AI-enhanced training system for underemployed individuals.

items.title: German court orders X to give data access to democracy researchers ahead of federal elections
items.author: Natasha Lomas
items.summary:
- A Berlin regional court ruled that X must provide data to civil society organizations for research on election integrity.
- The ruling is under the EU's Digital Services Act, which mandates platforms to assist researchers studying systemic risks.
- The ruling comes as Germany prepares for federal elections, with concerns about potential election interference and the influence of social media on public debates.

items.title: Microsoft Copilot: Everything you need to know about Microsoft’s AI
items.summary:
- Microsoft Copilot is a suite of generative AI tools designed to enhance productivity across various Microsoft applications, including Outlook, Teams, and GitHub.
- Copilot is integrated with Microsoft’s search engine, Bing, and features stand-alone apps for iOS and Android.
- The tool utilizes OpenAI’s models for tasks like content generation, translations, and summarizations.
- Copilot Pro costs $20/month and provides enhanced features across Microsoft 365 apps like Word and Excel.
- Microsoft 365 Copilot is priced at $30/user/month and includes enterprise-grade data protection and personalized responses.

items.title: Laurene Powell Jobs joins Amazon in backing nuclear startup X-Energy in $700M round
items.author: Tim De Chant
items.summary:
- Nuclear startup X-Energy has raised an additional $200 million, bringing its Series C round total to $700 million.
- New investors include Laurene Powell Jobs’s Emerson Collective, Ares Management, Jane Street, and Segra Capital Management.
- X-Energy's Xe-100 reactors are expected to generate 80 megawatts of electricity each, enough to power approximately 50,000 homes.
- Reactors utilize TRISO fuel for safety, with each containing about 200,000 carbon-coated uranium particles.
- The first reactor for Amazon is expected to be operational in the early 2030s.
- Funds will be used for reactor design, licensing, and the initial phase of a fuel fabrication plant in Oak Ridge, Tennessee.

items.title: Ilya Sutskever’s Startup in Talks for $20B Fundraising
items.summary:
- Safe Superintelligence, founded by Ilya Sutskever, seeks to raise funding at a valuation of at least $20 billion as of February 7, 2025.
- It is not clear how much funding the startup is aiming for; the new valuation is four times its previous $5 billion valuation from September 2024.
- Safe Superintelligence has yet to generate revenue and has raised $1 billion to date with backing from investors like Sequoia Capital, Andreessen Horowitz, and DST Global.
- Sutskever is recognized for his significant contributions to AI, notably during his time at OpenAI.

items.title: HPE begins notifying data breach victims after Russian government hack
items.author: Zack Whittaker
items.summary:
- Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) has notified individuals affected by a data breach attributed to Russian hackers in 2023.
- The breach involved personal information like Social Security numbers, driver’s license information, and credit card numbers.
- The cyberattack began in May 2023 and affected HPE's email and SharePoint systems, hosted by Microsoft.
- The hackers, known as Midnight Blizzard, are linked to Russia's foreign intelligence service, SVR.
- Microsoft confirmed their network was also compromised, targeting corporate executives and cybersecurity staff.

items.title: PromptLayer is building tools to put non-techies in the driver’s seat of AI app development
items.author: Jared Zoneraich, Jonathan Pedoeem
items.summary:
- PromptLayer is focused on building tools for non-technical users to enhance AI app development.
- The company has raised $4.8 million in a seed round led by Ivan Bercovich, with participation from several investors.
- Their platform features a 'prompt registry' for version control and testing of prompts, aimed at domain experts.
- PromptLayer has over 10,000 customers, with 13x revenue growth this year, primarily driven by word-of-mouth.

items.title: Pinterest lists DEI attacks as possible business risk in latest filing
items.author: Dominic-Madori Davis
items.summary: - Pinterest identified attacks on diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) as potential business risks in its latest 10-K filing. - The company stated that insufficient or excessive DEI efforts could harm talent acquisition, lead to investigations, and damage its brand reputation. - This follow-up comes after Target faced a lawsuit for not disclosing DEI risks, impacting its stock price after a backlash against its DEI efforts. - Many companies, including Pinterest, are reassessing their DEI commitments amid growing conservative attacks and lawsuits aimed at dismantling such initiatives. - Major tech companies like Meta, Amazon, and Google have also revised or eliminated their DEI programs following political pressure.

items.title: Hiveclass, a platform for virtual PE classes for kids, raises $1.5M
items.author: Lauren Forristal
items.summary:
• Hiveclass is a New York-based edtech platform providing online P.E. classes for K-12 students, covering fitness, dance, yoga, and more.
• The platform aims to combat disengagement in physical education and the high costs of youth sports.
• Recently raised $1.5 million in seed funding to enhance product development, a teacher portal, and services for special needs students.
• Hiveclass markets to public schools instead of directly to parents, partnering with over 80 educational institutions and engaging more than 13,000 students.
• The company has generated over $2 million in revenue and aims for an additional $1 million soon, exploring further revenue streams.
• Led by Spring Mountain Capital, the funding round included various investors and brings total raised to over $3 million.

items.title: Coalition of US states to file lawsuit after Musk’s DOGE gains access to Americans’ personal data
items.author: Zack Whittaker
items.summary:
- A coalition of over a dozen U.S. states plans to file a lawsuit against Elon Musk's DOGE team for accessing sensitive federal payment systems containing American personal data.
- The coalition is led by 13 Democratic attorneys general, including those from California, Connecticut, Maine, Maryland, and New York, seeking to defend privacy rights and essential funding for communities.
- Musk’s DOGE has recently gained control of major U.S. agencies, raising concerns about national security due to Musk's business ties with China.

items.title: UK government demands Apple backdoor to encrypted cloud data: report
items.summary:
- The UK government secretly ordered Apple to create a backdoor for accessing users' encrypted iCloud data.
- The demand was made in January under the UK's Investigatory Powers Act 2016, requesting blanket access to all encrypted files.
- Apple may stop offering its encrypted cloud storage, Advanced Data Protection, to UK users due to this demand.

items.title: Composo helps enterprises monitor how well AI apps work
items.author: Sebastian Fox
items.summary:
- London-based startup [Composo](https://www.composo.ai/) helps enterprises evaluate the accuracy of large language model applications.
- Offers both no-code and API options, allowing non-developers to assess AI apps.
- Recently raised $2 million in pre-seed funding, working with clients like Accenture and Palantir.
- Plans to expand its engineering team and bolster R&D efforts.
- Focuses on reducing risks associated with unreliable AI in various industries including compliance, legal, healthcare, and security.

items.title: PowerSchool data breach affected 16,000 students in the UK
items.author: Carly Page
items.summary:
- U.S. edtech giant PowerSchool confirmed a data breach affecting 16,000 students in the UK in December 2024.
- The breach involved hackers accessing personal data via compromised customer support credentials.
- Affected data includes contact information, dates of birth, limited medical data, and related information.
- Four UK schools were specifically mentioned as impacted, though names were not disclosed.
- PowerSchool has not reported the breach to the Information Commissioner’s Office (ICO) in the UK yet.

items.title: UAE to invest billions to build AI data center in France
items.author: Romain Dillet
items.summary:
- UAE and France signed an agreement to invest €30 to €50 billion ($31 to 52 billion) for an AI data center in France.
- The data center will have a capacity of up to 1GW and is part of preparations for the AI Action Summit in Paris.
- France has identified 35 possible locations for new data centers and aims to attract foreign investments, especially in renewable energy.
- A consortium of French and Emirati investors, including the Emirati firm MGX, will support the project.
- The AI Action Summit will be attended by global leaders, discussing various investments and the environmental impact of AI.

items.title: Meta launches new program to improve speech and translation AI
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary: • Meta is launching a program in partnership with UNESCO to collect speech recordings and transcriptions for AI development. • The Language Technology Partner Program seeks collaborators for diverse languages, requiring over 10 hours of recordings and transcriptions. • Current partners include the government of Nunavut, focusing on underserved languages like Inuktut. • Meta is also releasing an open source machine translation benchmark to assess language models. • The initiatives are framed as philanthropic, but Meta aims to enhance its own AI capabilities for translation and speech recognition.

items.title: Meta is studying how humans and robots can collaborate on housework
items.author: Brian Heater
items.summary:
- Meta launched PARTNR, a program to study human-robot interaction focused on collaboration in domestic tasks like cleaning and cooking.
- Automated housework has been a longstanding aspiration, but only robot vacuums have gained traction in the market due to issues like cost and functionality.
- PARTNR includes 100,000 tasks for robots, with a dataset released for training AI models, also successfully tested with Boston Dynamics’ Spot robot.
- The initiative aims to reimagine robots as partners in households, facilitating research in human-robot collaboration.

items.title: Swiggy, 2024’s biggest tech listing, falls below its IPO price and 2022 valuation
items.author: Manish Singh
items.summary:
- Swiggy's stock dropped to ₹374.80 ($4.29), below its November IPO price of ₹390.
- The decrease in stock price resulted in a market cap of $9.75 billion.
- Swiggy's Instamart business reported a loss of market share despite store expansion and increased marketing.
- Competitor Zomato's Blinkit achieved double the gross order value of Instamart this quarter.
- Swiggy added 96 dark stores, totaling 705, but was outpaced by Blinkit's 216 stores for a total of 1,007.
- Swiggy's cash reserves are ₹82 billion ($936 million), less than Zomato's ₹190 billion ($2.2 billion).

items.title: India to launch new domain name for banks to fight digital fraud
items.summary:
- India’s central bank is introducing a new domain, “.bank.in”, for banks starting April 2025 to combat digital payment fraud.
- The Institute for Development and Research in Banking Technology (IDRBT) will be the exclusive registrar for this domain.
- A separate ‘fin.in’ domain will also be launched for non-bank financial institutions.
- RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra emphasized the need for this initiative to combat increased cyber security threats and fraud in digital payments.
- The move addresses the rising incidents of fraud and aims to help users identify legitimate banking sites.

items.title: Sprinklr cuts 500 employees, citing underwhelming business performance
items.author: Jagmeet Singh
items.summary:
- Sprinklr has laid off about 500 employees (15% of its workforce) due to underwhelming business performance.
- This follows previous layoffs of 3% in May 2024 and 4% in 2023, totaling around 200 employees affected.
- The company will continue to hire in prioritized areas and emphasized a refocus on its strategic priorities, including AI development.

items.title: Carried interest repeal could stifle investments in startups, NVCA says
items.author: Marina Temkin
items.summary:
- President Trump requested Republican lawmakers to end tax breaks on carried interest.
- Carried interest tax break allows private equity managers to benefit from lower capital gains rates.
- Removal of this tax break could significantly impact the VC industry, according to NVCA President Bobby Franklin.
- Franklin expressed that carried interest supports high-risk investments in startups.
- Previous attempts to eliminate the loophole were not included in the 2017 Tax Cuts and Jobs Act.
- The 2017 modifications helped maintain venture investments in emerging technologies like AI and crypto.
- Majority of capital for emerging tech companies is still concentrated in New York and Silicon Valley.

items.title: OpenAI’s ex-CTO, Mira Murati, recruits co-founder John Schulman for new startup
items.summary:
- John Schulman, ex-co-founder of OpenAI, is joining Mira Murati’s new startup after leaving Anthropic.
- Schulman left Anthropic after five months, and his specific role in the new venture is unclear.
- Murati has also recruited other former OpenAI staff, including Christian Gibson from the supercomputing team.
- She was in talks to raise over $100 million for her startup as of October.

items.title: Orgs demand action to mitigate AI’s environmental harm
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Over 100 organizations published an [open letter](https://greenscreen.network/en/blog/within-bounds-limiting-ai-environmental-impact/) urging action against AI's environmental impact just before a major AI conference in Paris.
- The letter highlights evidence of AI systems increasing emissions and reliance on non-renewables, yet minimal action is taken.
- Demands include ensuring AI infrastructure is fossil fuel-free to combat increased electricity consumption tied to AI development, projected to double by 2026.
- The letter calls for transparency regarding AI's environmental impacts and responsible use of water and land resources by data centers.
- Vulnerable communities face the brunt of AI's impact amidst a U.S. trend favoring rapid growth, including support for coal energy for AI data centers.

items.title: Amazon doubles down on AI with a massive $100B spending plan for 2025
items.author: Charles Rollet
items.summary:
- Amazon plans to invest over $100 billion in AI capabilities for 2025, focusing on its AWS cloud division.
- CEO Andy Jassy indicated that the Q4 2024 capex of $26.3 billion is representative of annual spending for 2025, totaling approximately $105.2 billion.
- This marks an increase from the $75 billion capex expected in 2024.
- Jassy dismissed concerns about reduced AI costs impacting revenue, asserting that lower prices increase demand instead.
- Other tech giants like Meta and Microsoft also announced massive AI spending plans for the coming years, highlighting a trend in the industry.

items.title: Government agency removes spoon emoji from work platform amid protests
items.summary:
- The U.S. General Services Administration (GSA) removed the spoon emoji from its videoconferencing platform.
- The removal followed protests by workers who used the emoji to express dissent against the Trump administration's resignation offer titled "A Fork in the Road."
- Federal employees protested during a 600-person video conference and some changed their Slack statuses to feature the spoon emoji.

items.title: Early Meta Employee Sues for Sexual Harassment, Gender Discrimination
items.summary:
- Kelly Stonelake, a former Meta director, filed a lawsuit against the company in Washington for sexual harassment, gender discrimination, and retaliation.
- Stonelake claims she faced ongoing harassment and discrimination from 2009 until her layoff in January 2024, including incidents involving unwanted physical contact and coercion for promotions.
- Despite reporting harassment, Meta allegedly took no action, leading to ongoing mental health issues for Stonelake, who was on medical leave for PTSD when she was laid off.

items.title: OpenAI now reveals more of its o3-mini model’s thought process
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- OpenAI updates the communication style of its o3-mini model to clarify its reasoning process in response to competitive pressure.
- Free and premium ChatGPT users will see an enhanced “chain of thought” feature detailing how the model formulates answers.
- The update aims to make the model's reasoning clearer and more accessible, particularly for non-English users, while still not disclosing the full thought process.
